FuncDef:
The clock source ssm command configures an SSM quality level for a PTP clock source.
The undo clock source ssm command deletes the SSM quality level of a PTP clock source. The clock source ssm command configures an SSM quality level for a PTP clock source. The undo clock source ssm command deletes the SSM quality level of a PTP clock source. By default, no SSM quality level is configured for a PTP clock source. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H-48S6CQ, CE6881H-48S6CQ-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: clock source ptp ssm { prc | ssua | ssub | sec | dnu | unk }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the SSM level is PRC (G.811 clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SSUA (G.812 transit node clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SSUB (G.812 local node clock signal).
-

Indicates that the SSM level is SDH.
-

Indicates that the SSM level is not used for clock synchronization.
-

Indicates that the SSM level is unknown clock synchronization quality.
-

Specifies a PTP clock source as the master clock source.
-
